title: I wouldn't have a problem with Tristana if she didn't have so many failsafe mechanics
body:
And couldn't perform so many roles so well.
Personally I feel like ADC are in the same spot that assassins are in, in which their items are the main source of their damage output rather than their kits. This is probably also why the first ADC to get {{item:3031}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3087}} gets to be the best, regardless of if it's {{champion:51}} {{champion:18}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:29}}.

The main reason why Tristana is so overwhelming, is because she's allowed to pump out damage almost identical to other carries while being super safe due to her kit.

* Currently Tristana has top DPS and can pump it out at a higher range than Caitlyn
* Her rocket jump is either an engage or a disengage tool, and it's resetable.
    If she can't reset it through killing someone, she can just detonate her E at max charge to get a free reset
* If someone still manages to close in on her, she burst people with a 300-500 base damage ability and does a long AoE 600-1000 unit knockback

I'd be totally fine with Tristana being your go to safety ADC, being able to work well into heavy gap closer combs {{champion:107}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:92}}, but I don't like that she gets to be master of all trades.

{{champion:51}} gets really high range on her attacks, but the cost of that is low ability damage and no steroids.
{{champion:22}} Also has a really high attack range, but that's for the sake of being a kite ADC and due to her having CC she has sacrificed a significant portion of her damage output.

Tristana on the other hand just has it all. CC? Check. Extreme mobility? Check. Long attack range? Check. High AS steroids? Check (7 bloody seconds...). There's no situation where it's a bad choice to pick Tristana, because quite frankly she has it all.

One of the oldest example of that is Ezreal cheesing Blitzcrank grabs. Tristana can do it too, if timed perfectly.

The problem there is coding and how placement altering effects interact. There isn't any fix for that, if it was doable it would've been done. Obviously Tristana receives more hate for that, because her dash covers a very long distance.
The other reason people notice it so much is because it has such a long cast time for a dash. The cast time is why you can outright kill her before she gets away if enough damage hits her.

You can tell the game's becoming more and more casual as you see people on boards with no goddamn idea what they're talking about.

Aside from her bomb formerly being Grievous Wounds (and no "burst" on 4th hit) Tristana has LITERALLY had her entire kit exactly as it exists now (with various numbers tweaks) since she was introduced. Her jump, knockback, range and steroid have ALL been there from the beginning and she has at times been viewed as complete TRASH tier and other times S tier.  And there has really been NO change to her "kit" in the time between.  Heck, her range used to be LONGER and all her kit items used to synergize more with cooldowns, and she STILL wasn't "must pick".  She's been a common pick this season, but again HOW HAS HER KIT CHANGED?  It hasn't, AT ALL.  She had her ult cooldown extended in 8.4 and had her overall range reduced in 8.5. (max now 661 instead of 669, for comparison, with Fishbones Jinx can hit 700)

The one debatable point is that ORIGINALLY Tristana's "weak point" was supposed to be "mid-game".  And Riot seems determined to get rid of mid-game, presumably because it is boring.  So she's decent at early game and (as intended) strong in "late game", so now it's hard to hit her "weak point" because Riot doesn't want that phase to exist.  That's a GAME problem tho.

Having a single AD ratio added to a kit at no real downside was a massive buff as well as adding more ways to reset her jump (detonating E manually resets it). The only thing Tristana had in her kit before her rework was range. She didn't actually scale well, but was generally safe enough to pelt people down with bee bees until they died. Adding a 198% Bonus AD ratio to a kit with next to no trade offs (it added a condition that was fairly easy to achieve) and converting it to physical damage caused her damage to actually scale fairly hard and have burst attached to it. Tristana's damage from her kit stopped at level 9 unless you built AP (the ult did go up a bit in damage at level 11/16) with the rest being multiplicative stats with items (AS is useless on its own). All of Tristana's damage before the rework was directly related to how good items were since that was the ONLY way she did damage. Adding a ratio to her E still does cause her damage to be fairly correlated with items, but a 198% AD ratio causes her E to do ~170 more damage with just IE+DBlade on a fully stacked one (which yet again isn't very hard with IE+Zeal item and about level 10 so 3 points in Q).

Her laning phase is now trash since the last nerf unless enemy fucks up and she gets a successfull all-in early.
